title: How do we activate our subconscious mind to work? - Quora

response.answer_text: Subconscious Mind.. An Unsolvable Open Puzzle..  Think of a deep well.. You will see water when you look down into it.. The water is always there in it.. You need to draw water from the deep well if ever you want..  The water is available to you if you know how to draw it from the depth of the well.. If not, the water will continue to remain where it was, and only supports the trees nearby.. Similarly, the subconscious mind is like a deep well.. and the power of the subconscious mind is like the water deep down there.. You can draw this power by certain meditation techniques.. Orelse, it will support only your natural needs.. How to draw? Firstly you need to ‘believe’ in the power of your subconscious mind.. Belief is the password to your subconscious mind..You need to connect to your subconscious mind.. For this you need to learn the meditation techniques and exercises that help to work with your subconscious..Daily meditation: To start with, I will explain to you a meditation technique to improve your health.. and heal your body from stubborn ailments..  Spend time everyday to do this exercise.. Do it either in the morning.. or at night, at the time of sleep..Sit at a silent place.., (sitting on your bed is also fine), close your eyes, feel relaxed, make yourself calm.. Free your body and mind from any tension.. Loosen your muscles, loosen your nerves.. Take slow and steady breaths for few times..Now slowly and steadily suggest yourself in your mind repeatedly as follows, all the while clearly visualizing what you suggest..“My subconscious mind is powerful.. I believe in the power of my subconscious mind.. My subconscious mind has the power to make my thoughts materialize.. By the power of my subconscious mind I become healthy and I remain happy.. My body and all my cells listen and follow my thoughts.. All my cells, organs and limbs are beginning to feel better, becoming healthy and rejuvenated.. I direct my Mind Energy to cleanse my body and remove all the bloks, remove all the congestions, remove all the infections and diseases from my body.. I an seeing this happening now.. And I am becoming healthy and strong..”While you give the above mental suggestions to yourself, put your best visualization to work.. Visualize your body cleansing itself, the blocks getting cleared, blood flowing freely through the arteries, fresh air passing freely through your nostrils, wind pipe and through the lungs, all the infections and disease causing agents leaving your body and melting away.., all the internal organs getting rejuvenated one by one, and you are feeling better and happy and healthy.. Once you finish with the self-suggestions and visualization, feel yourself happy and confident of what you have done, and end your meditation with a complete self trust and peace of mind. Do this meditation once or twice a day regularly for at least a month to see a good change in your health.. You can alter or modify the self-suggestions and visualizations to what suits you.. You can incorporate issues of your health, your appearance, confidence, or any physical and mental improvement that you look for yourself.. But take one issue at a time.. Do not mix multiples. You can also use this meditation technique to: Heal your wounds, injuries, blocks, and heal chronic ailments,Improve your performance in sports and other social activities.,Improve sexuality.,Keep away bad friends and bad elements.,Control over self, control over bad habits.. control over negative thoughts..For a best result, practice at the same time everyday.. The best time to do this practice is during 10.30pm to 11.30pm and 4am to 6am.. Please ‘follow’ my profile on quora for regular articles on Mind and Mind-Power. Stay Blessed.. There are many parts of the mind we are not conscious or aware of. These parts of the mind are working all the time. You can not “activate” the subconscious if, by that, you mean become aware of it working. Once you are aware of it, it is no longer subconscious. The subconscious can only be subconscious as long as your are unaware of its workings. So you don’t have to do anything to activate your subconscious mind. It’s already active and doing its job — or jobs, since there are actually many different brain functions that happen without conscious awareness. We are not consciously aware of our brains managing many functions, including automatic responses to triggering events (habits)feelings and emotions (they seem to appear without thought)perceptions (use of our senses)preprocessing of perceptions (our senses only scan the environment for data; a part of the subconscious puts those data points together to make it appear to the conscious brain as if we have a full picture of what is around us)autonomic functions (heart beating and breathing; blood pressure).These are all functions I believe must be there. I’m not a neuroscientist. Just an observer of myself. I infer their existence, but I am not conscious of those things happening, and I believe it is not possible to become conscious of most of these processes. However, perhaps you are asking about something else. Perhaps you are asking whether it is possible to become conscious of the subconscious workings of your mind. If that is what you are asking, then the answer is meditation. In order to become aware of subconscious thinking, you have to quiet the conscious brain enough that you can begin to observe the rest of the brain. The conscious brain is generally very noisy, what with all its thinking. All those thoughts obscure awareness of things like the appearance of emotions/feelings, awareness of heartbeat or breath, habits, or attention to whether perceptions are real or imagined. To become aware of these things, you have to still your conscious thinking and wait patiently to notice the other things happening in your awareness. This is difficult work and it takes lots and lots of practice. Meditation is one of the more traditional ways to accomplish this awareness, but there are many other ways it can be done. For example, engaging in exercise, creative work, or any other activity that involves a strong measure of focus will help us become aware of the normally subconscious thinking that happens in our minds. To reiterate, your subconscious is always active — even when you are asleep. You just aren’t aware of it. That’s why it’s called the subconscious. Its activity occurs below or outside your conscious awareness. You can’t activate your subconscious because it is always active. However, if you want to become a little bit more aware of what the subconscious parts of your mind are doing, meditation will help with that.
